titleStmt.title: Office of the Adjutant General of Indiana

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Office of the Adjutant General of Indiana

body.p: The office of the chief military officer and advisor to the Governor of the State of Indiana. Resides in the Executive Branch of the State of Indiana. Civil War-era Adjutant Generals: Lazarus Noble (1861-1864) and William Henry Harrison Terrell (1864-1869).

ab.bibl:
"Death of General Noble," The Evansville Journal (Evansville, IN), October 22, 1879, p. 4.
David Bodenhamer and Robert G. Barrows, The Encyclopedia of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN: Indiana University Press, 1994) 1329.
Report of the Adjutant General of Indiana, vol. 1, (Indianapolis, IN: Alexander H. Conner, State Printer, 1869).
